Given A is an <math>n \times n</math> matrix and <math>\vec{v}</math> and <math>\vec{u}</math> are elements in <math>\mathbb{R}^n</math>. Say that v is an eigenvector for <math>A^T</math> and w is an eigenvector for A. So we have that
statement_html:
Determine if each of the following statements is true of false. Show reason or proof if true and show reason or counter example if false.

If an \(\displaystyle n \times x\) matrix A is real-valued and if \(\displaystyle Av = \lambda v\), \(\displaystyle A^{T}w= \mu w\) then \(\displaystyle v \perp w\) if \(\displaystyle \lambda \neq \mu\). (In other words, every eigenvector of A is orthogonal to every eigenvector of \(\displaystyle A^{T}\) if they correspond to different eigenvalues.)
statement_latex:
Determine if each of the following statements is true of false. Show
reason or proof if true and show reason or counter example if false.

If an $\displaystyle n \times x$ matrix \emph{A} is real-valued and if
$\displaystyle Av = \lambda v$, $\displaystyle A^{T}w= \mu w$ then
$\displaystyle v \perp w$ if $\displaystyle \lambda \neq \mu$. (In other
words, every eigenvector of \emph{A} is orthogonal to every eigenvector
of $\displaystyle A^{T}$ if they correspond to different eigenvalues.)
statement_raw:
Determine if each of the following statements is true of false. Show reason or proof if true and show reason or counter example if false.

If an <math> \displaystyle n \times x </math> matrix ''A'' is real-valued and if <math> \displaystyle Av = \lambda v</math>, <math> \displaystyle A^{T}w= \mu w</math> then <math> \displaystyle v \perp w</math> if <math> \displaystyle \lambda \neq \mu</math>. (In other words, every eigenvector of ''A'' is orthogonal to every eigenvector of <math> \displaystyle A^{T} </math> if they correspond to different eigenvalues.)
